page.title: 01Principal Features
page.content: The 12 sq. km. block lies west of Newcastle-Upon-Tyne.The landscape is varied:council estates;private estates;villages with their own self-sufficient characteristics,eg.Newburn and Walbottle; industrial areas; industrial wasteland;farmland;rural districts;with the River Tyne and the main road west out of Newcastle cutting diagonally through the square.The growth of industry up the Tyne from Newcastle to Newburn is evident,as is the spread of life up from the river and out from the city itself.The area is saturated with history:dating from the Roman occupation of Britain through to twentieth century industrial archaeology.Hadrian's Wall is in evidence;the positions of milecastles and the vallum marked.The Civil War
